meanings.definition: To breed with individuals of a different breed or species.
meanings.sent1: The farmer decided to outbreed his cows with a rare breed to create unique hybrids.
meanings.sent2: Some birds outbreed to ensure genetic diversity within their population.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper joked that the monkeys were planning to outbreed the neighboring lemurs.
meanings.sent4: In the world of flowers, some species outbreed to create stunning new hybrids.
meanings.sent5: The scientist explained how certain fish species outbreed to adapt to changing environments.

meanings.definition: To produce offspring at a faster rate than others.
meanings.sent1: Rabbits are known to outbreed rapidly, leading to overpopulation in some areas.
meanings.sent2: Certain insects have the ability to outbreed other species due to their short reproductive cycles.
meanings.sent3: The garden was filled with flowers that seemed to outbreed overnight.
meanings.sent4: The bacteria in the petri dish seemed to outbreed at an astonishing pace.
meanings.sent5: The invasive species was able to outbreed the native plants, causing ecological imbalance.
